introduction: The following text is adapted from Wuthering Heights by Emily Brontë (1847). Lockwood reflects on his growing curiosity about Heathcliff.
text: Lockwood had been observing Heathcliff for some time, and his fascination with the man grew with each passing day. <u>Heathcliff’s behavior was unpredictable, his moods swinging from cold indifference to violent outbursts. But there was an intensity about him that made it impossible to look away. Lockwood couldn’t help but wonder what had shaped him into the man he had become—what secrets lay beneath that dark, brooding exterior.</u>
question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?
A: It suggests that Lockwood is becoming increasingly frustrated with Heathcliff’s behavior and is losing interest in him.
B: It highlights Lockwood’s curiosity about the complexities of Heathcliff’s character and the mystery surrounding him.
C: It illustrates Lockwood’s belief that Heathcliff’s mood swings are the result of an unstable personality.
D: It reflects Lockwood’s growing admiration for Heathcliff’s emotional depth and intensity.
